data.title: Congratulations to artists Sophie Khan (@sophiekahnstudio) and Marco Palli (@marco.palli), whose monuments are now publicly on view in...
data.meta_description:
251 likes, 10 comments - aslnyc on November 10, 2023: "Congratulations to artists Sophie Khan (@sophiekahnstudio) and Marco Palli (@marco.palli), whose monuments are now publicly on view in Manhattan's Riverside Park at 145th St.‚Å†
‚Å†
Yesterday, Khan's "Portrait of t." and Palli's "Our Gates" were unveiled in a special ceremony attended by representatives of the League, NYC Parks, New York State Council on the Arts, the Office of the Governor, and the New York State Legislature.‚Å†
‚Å†
This was made possible by our Works in Public program, which empowers artists to create site-specific, large-scale sculptures for public installation in NYC.‚Å† Founded in 2010 and guided by instructors Haksul Lee (@art74leehaksul) and Natsuki Takauji (@natsukiuji), this program is presented in partnership with @nycparks. (üîó in bio)‚Å†
‚Å†
#ArtStudentsLeague #ASLNYC #WorksInPublic #SophieKhan #MarcoPalli".
